title: Assessment of Gifu reservist associations

one resident of Takayama in Hida also accused the local reservists associa tion of indifference and inactivity. The nature of the criticism was that the reservists neglected the town’s shokonsha or war memorial shrine outside of ceremonial occasions to the point where the structure had crumbled and become dangerous for the holding of the annual draft examinations

Compare this with Richard Smethurst’s statement that rural reservists commanded natural respect in their communities because they were the fittest men in their prime work years and the leaders of other village organizations, A Social Basis for Prewar Japanese Militarism: the Army and the Rural Community
